title: Quiz 6: Epidemiology & Disease Prevention
description: Test your grasp of the epidemiological triad, disease patterns, and the three levels of prevention.

questions.question: The Epidemiological Triad consists of the Agent, the ___BLANK___, and the ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Disease results from the interaction of Agent, Host, and Environment.
questions.hint: Who gets sick and where do they live?

questions.question: Match the disease occurrence pattern to its definition:

pairs.right: Unexpected increase (outbreak) in a short time
Present constantly over a long duration

questions.question: Immunization and health education are examples of which level of prevention?
questions.explanation: Primary prevention occurs BEFORE disease starts (e.g., vaccines).

questions.question: Which of the following are **Host Factors** influencing disease? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Age, immunity, and lifestyle are internal to the Host. Climate and vectors are Environmental factors.

questions.question: What is the study of disease distribution and determinants in a population called?
questions.explanation: Epidemiology is the study of disease patterns and causes in populations.

questions.question: Order the levels of prevention from earliest intervention to latest:
Secondary prevention aims to detect disease at which stage?
questions.explanation: Secondary prevention (e.g., screening) targets the sub-clinical stage before symptoms appear.

questions.question: Malaria in parts of Kenya is considered a sporadic disease.
questions.explanation: Malaria is **endemic** in parts of Kenya (present all the time), not sporadic.

questions.question: Match the agent type to its example:
Which type of epidemiological study involves following a group over time to see outcomes (Prospective)?
questions.explanation: Cohort studies are prospective (moving forward in time). Case control studies are retrospective.
